trans-unit.source: End user experience for MAM enabled apps | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: End user experience for MAM enabled apps | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: This topic describes what to expect when your app is managed by mobile app management policies.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes what to expect when your app is managed by mobile app management policies.

trans-unit.source: End user experience for MAM enabled apps with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: End user experience for MAM enabled apps with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Mobile application management (MAM) polices are applied only when apps are used in the work context.
trans-unit.target: Mobile application management (MAM) polices are applied only when apps are used in the work context.

trans-unit.source: Read the following scenarios to understand how managed apps work.
trans-unit.target: Read the following scenarios to understand how managed apps work.

trans-unit.source: Accessing OneDrive on an iOS device
trans-unit.target: Accessing OneDrive on an iOS device

trans-unit.source: Launch the **OneDrive** app to open the sign in page.
trans-unit.target: Launch the **OneDrive** app to open the sign in page.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the One drive log in page
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the One drive log in page

trans-unit.source: On a personal device, typically the end user would download the app.
trans-unit.target: On a personal device, typically the end user would download the app.

trans-unit.source: If the device is managed by a MDM solution, your can deploy the app to the device.
trans-unit.target: If the device is managed by a MDM solution, your can deploy the app to the device.

trans-unit.source: Type your work account user name.
trans-unit.target: Type your work account user name.

trans-unit.source: You are redirected to the **O365 authentication** page to enter your work credentials.
trans-unit.target: You are redirected to the **O365 authentication** page to enter your work credentials.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the O365 log in page
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the O365 log in page

trans-unit.source: After your credentials are successfully authenticated by Azure AD, the MAM polices are applied, and you will be asked to restart the **OneDrive** app.
trans-unit.target: After your credentials are successfully authenticated by Azure AD, the MAM polices are applied, and you will be asked to restart the **OneDrive** app.

trans-unit.source: [NOTE!] The restart required dialog box is displayed only on devices that are not enrolled in Intune.
trans-unit.target: [NOTE!] The restart required dialog box is displayed only on devices that are not enrolled in Intune.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the Restart required dialog box
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the Restart required dialog box

trans-unit.source: When you re-launch the **OneDrive** app, the app launches with the MAM policies turned on.
trans-unit.target: When you re-launch the **OneDrive** app, the app launches with the MAM policies turned on.

trans-unit.source: You are now prompted to set a **PIN** for the app.
trans-unit.target: You are now prompted to set a **PIN** for the app.

trans-unit.source: (if you configured the policy for this).
trans-unit.target: (if you configured the policy for this).

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of OneDrive app asking for a PIN
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of OneDrive app asking for a PIN

trans-unit.source: Once you set the PIN and confirm, you are able to access the files on your **OneDrive for Business**.
trans-unit.target: Once you set the PIN and confirm, you are able to access the files on your **OneDrive for Business**.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot showing the file location open with the list of existing files
trans-unit.target: Screenshot showing the file location open with the list of existing files

trans-unit.source: When you change a deployed policy, the changes will be applied next time you open the app.
trans-unit.target: When you change a deployed policy, the changes will be applied next time you open the app.

trans-unit.source: Accessing OneDrive on an Android device
trans-unit.target: Accessing OneDrive on an Android device

trans-unit.source: Launch the OneDrive app to open the sign in page.
trans-unit.target: Launch the OneDrive app to open the sign in page.

trans-unit.source: On a personal device, typically the end user would download the app.
trans-unit.target: On a personal device, typically the end user would download the app.

trans-unit.source: If the device is managed by a MDM solution, you can deploy the app to the device.
trans-unit.target: If the device is managed by a MDM solution, you can deploy the app to the device.

trans-unit.source: Type your work account user name.
trans-unit.target: Type your work account user name.

trans-unit.source: You are redirected to the **O365 authentication** page to enter your work credentials.
trans-unit.target: You are redirected to the **O365 authentication** page to enter your work credentials.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of O365 sign in page on an Android device
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of O365 sign in page on an Android device

trans-unit.source: Once your credentials are successfully authenticated by **Azure AD**, you should see a message displayed with instructions to install the company portal app, if it is not already installed on the device.
trans-unit.target: Once your credentials are successfully authenticated by **Azure AD**, you should see a message displayed with instructions to install the company portal app, if it is not already installed on the device.

trans-unit.source: Tap on **Get the app** to proceed.
trans-unit.target: Tap on **Get the app** to proceed.

trans-unit.source: The Company Portal app is required for all apps associated with MAM policies on Android devices.
trans-unit.target: The Company Portal app is required for all apps associated with MAM policies on Android devices.

trans-unit.source: For devices not enrolled in Intune, the app must be installed on the device, but does not require launching or signing into the app.
trans-unit.target: For devices not enrolled in Intune, the app must be installed on the device, but does not require launching or signing into the app.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the dialog box with the company portal app install requirement message
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the dialog box with the company portal app install requirement message

trans-unit.source: You are now in the **Google Play** store where you can download and install the **Company Portal** app.
trans-unit.target: You are now in the **Google Play** store where you can download and install the **Company Portal** app.

trans-unit.source: The Company Portal app helps keep the data secure and protected.
trans-unit.target: The Company Portal app helps keep the data secure and protected.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the company portal app
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the company portal app

trans-unit.source: Once you have completed the install, choose **Accept** to accept the terms.
trans-unit.target: Once you have completed the install, choose **Accept** to accept the terms.

trans-unit.source: The **OneDrive** app launches automatically.
trans-unit.target: The **OneDrive** app launches automatically.

trans-unit.source: The next time you open OneDrive, you will see the prompt to set a **PIN**, provided the policy settings are set to require a PIN to access the **OneDrive** app.
trans-unit.target: The next time you open OneDrive, you will see the prompt to set a **PIN**, provided the policy settings are set to require a PIN to access the **OneDrive** app.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the OneDrive app with the PIN prompt
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the OneDrive app with the PIN prompt

trans-unit.source: Once the PIN is set and confirmed, you can continue using **OneDrive**, which is now managed by app policies.
trans-unit.target: Once the PIN is set and confirmed, you can continue using **OneDrive**, which is now managed by app policies.

trans-unit.source: Using apps with multi-identity support
trans-unit.target: Using apps with multi-identity support

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Word is used as an example for this scenario.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Word is used as an example for this scenario.

trans-unit.source: Open the **Word** app on your device.
trans-unit.target: Open the **Word** app on your device.

trans-unit.source: We are using an iOS device to show the steps.
trans-unit.target: We are using an iOS device to show the steps.

trans-unit.source: Tap **New** to create a new word document.
trans-unit.target: Tap **New** to create a new word document.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of an iOS device with the New menu option displayed at the bottom of the screen
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of an iOS device with the New menu option displayed at the bottom of the screen

trans-unit.source: Type a sentence of your choice.
trans-unit.target: Type a sentence of your choice.

trans-unit.source: When you try to save this document, both personal and work locations are shown as options to save the document you just created.
trans-unit.target: When you try to save this document, both personal and work locations are shown as options to save the document you just created.

trans-unit.source: At this step, the app policies are not yet applied since this work/personal context is not yet established.
trans-unit.target: At this step, the app policies are not yet applied since this work/personal context is not yet established.

trans-unit.source: Save the document to your OneDrive for business location.
trans-unit.target: Save the document to your OneDrive for business location.

trans-unit.source: This is now tagged as company data and the policy restrictions apply.
trans-unit.target: This is now tagged as company data and the policy restrictions apply.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of a typed sentence in a Word document
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of a typed sentence in a Word document

trans-unit.source: Open the document you saved to your work location.
trans-unit.target: Open the document you saved to your work location.

trans-unit.source: Copy the text, open your personal **Facebook** account and try to paste the copied text.
trans-unit.target: Copy the text, open your personal **Facebook** account and try to paste the copied text.

trans-unit.source: You should not be able paste the content into the new Facebook post.
trans-unit.target: You should not be able paste the content into the new Facebook post.

trans-unit.source: The paste option is not greyed out, but nothing happens when you press **Paste**.
trans-unit.target: The paste option is not greyed out, but nothing happens when you press **Paste**.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot showing the cut, copy, and paste selections
trans-unit.target: Screenshot showing the cut, copy, and paste selections

trans-unit.source: Screenshot showing no pasted data in the Facebook post
trans-unit.target: Screenshot showing no pasted data in the Facebook post

trans-unit.source: Now repeat steps 2 and 3 to create another new document, type a sentence of your choice, and instead of saving it to your work, save it to your personal location, like **OneDrive - personal**.
trans-unit.target: Now repeat steps 2 and 3 to create another new document, type a sentence of your choice, and instead of saving it to your work, save it to your personal location, like **OneDrive - personal**.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the cut, copy, and paste selection with the sentence selected to copy
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the cut, copy, and paste selection with the sentence selected to copy

trans-unit.source: Open the personal saved document.
trans-unit.target: Open the personal saved document.

trans-unit.source: Copy the text, open the **Facebook** app and try to paste the copied text.
trans-unit.target: Copy the text, open the **Facebook** app and try to paste the copied text.

trans-unit.source: You see that you are able to paste the content to a Facebook post.
trans-unit.target: You see that you are able to paste the content to a Facebook post.

trans-unit.source: Content showing as pasted in the Facebook post
trans-unit.target: Content showing as pasted in the Facebook post

trans-unit.source: Managing user accounts
trans-unit.target: Managing user accounts

trans-unit.source: Intune only supports deploying MAM policies to only one user account per device.
trans-unit.target: Intune only supports deploying MAM policies to only one user account per device.

trans-unit.source: If a device has more than one work account, only one work account is managed by the MAM policies.
trans-unit.target: If a device has more than one work account, only one work account is managed by the MAM policies.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the app that you are using, the second user may or may not be blocked on the device.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the app that you are using, the second user may or may not be blocked on the device.

trans-unit.source: However, in all cases, only the first user who gets the MAM policies is affected by the policy.
trans-unit.target: However, in all cases, only the first user who gets the MAM policies is affected by the policy.

trans-unit.source: If a device has existing multiple user accounts before the MAM policies are deployed, the account that the MAM policies is deployed to first is managed by Intune MAM policies.
trans-unit.target: If a device has existing multiple user accounts before the MAM policies are deployed, the account that the MAM policies is deployed to first is managed by Intune MAM policies.

trans-unit.source: **Microsoft Word**, **Excel**, and **PowerPoint** don't block a second user account, but the second user account is not affected by the MAM policies.
trans-unit.target: **Microsoft Word**, **Excel**, and **PowerPoint** don't block a second user account, but the second user account is not affected by the MAM policies.

trans-unit.source: For **OneDrive and Outlook apps**, you can only use one work account.
trans-unit.target: For **OneDrive and Outlook apps**, you can only use one work account.

trans-unit.source: Adding multiple work accounts are blocked on these apps.
trans-unit.target: Adding multiple work accounts are blocked on these apps.

trans-unit.source: You can however, remove a user and add a different user on the device.
trans-unit.target: You can however, remove a user and add a different user on the device.

trans-unit.source: Read the example scenario below to get a deeper understanding of how multiple user accounts are treated.
trans-unit.target: Read the example scenario below to get a deeper understanding of how multiple user accounts are treated.

trans-unit.source: User A works for two companies - **Company X**, and **Company Y**. User A has a work account for each company, and both use Intune to deploy MAM policies.
trans-unit.target: User A works for two companies - **Company X**, and **Company Y**. User A has a work account for each company, and both use Intune to deploy MAM policies.

trans-unit.source: **Company X** deploys MAM policies **before** **Company Y**. The account associated with **Company X** will get the MAM policy, but not the account associated with Company Y. If you want the user account associated with Company Y to be managed by the MAM policies, you must remove the user account associated with Company X.
trans-unit.target: **Company X** deploys MAM policies **before** **Company Y**. The account associated with **Company X** will get the MAM policy, but not the account associated with Company Y. If you want the user account associated with Company Y to be managed by the MAM policies, you must remove the user account associated with Company X.

trans-unit.source: Adding a second account
trans-unit.target: Adding a second account

trans-unit.source: IOS
trans-unit.target: IOS

trans-unit.source: If you are using an iOS device, when you try to add a second work account on the same device, you may see blocking message.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an iOS device, when you try to add a second work account on the same device, you may see blocking message.

trans-unit.source: You will also see an option to remove the existing account and add a new one.
trans-unit.target: You will also see an option to remove the existing account and add a new one.

trans-unit.source: You can do so by choosing **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: You can do so by choosing **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the dialog box with the blocking message and Yes and No options
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the dialog box with the blocking message and Yes and No options

trans-unit.source: Android
trans-unit.target: Android

trans-unit.source: If you are using an Android device, You may see a blocking message with instructions to remove the existing account and add a new one.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an Android device, You may see a blocking message with instructions to remove the existing account and add a new one.

trans-unit.source: On Android devices, to remove the existing account, go to **Settings >General > Application Manager >Company Portal and select "Clear Data"**.
trans-unit.target: On Android devices, to remove the existing account, go to **Settings >General > Application Manager >Company Portal and select "Clear Data"**.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the error message and instructions to remove the account
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the error message and instructions to remove the account

trans-unit.source: Viewing media files with the Rights Management sharing app
trans-unit.target: Viewing media files with the Rights Management sharing app

trans-unit.source: To view company AV, PDF, and image files on Android devices, use the [Microsoft Rights Management (RMS) sharing app](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.ipviewer).
trans-unit.target: To view company AV, PDF, and image files on Android devices, use the [Microsoft Rights Management (RMS) sharing app](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.microsoft.ipviewer).

trans-unit.source: Download this app from the Google Play store.
trans-unit.target: Download this app from the Google Play store.

trans-unit.source: Once the app is installed on your device, launch the app and authenticate with your company credentials.
trans-unit.target: Once the app is installed on your device, launch the app and authenticate with your company credentials.

trans-unit.source: You should now be able to view unprotected and protected files from other policy-managed apps.
trans-unit.target: You should now be able to view unprotected and protected files from other policy-managed apps.

trans-unit.source: The following filetypes are supported:
trans-unit.target: The following filetypes are supported:

trans-unit.source: **Audio:** AAC LC, HE-AACv1 (AAC+), HE-AACv2 (enhanced AAC+), AAC ELD (enhanced low delay AAC), AMR-NB, AMR-WB, FLAC, MP3, MIDI, Vorbis, PCM/WAVE.
trans-unit.target: **Audio:** AAC LC, HE-AACv1 (AAC+), HE-AACv2 (enhanced AAC+), AAC ELD (enhanced low delay AAC), AMR-NB, AMR-WB, FLAC, MP3, MIDI, Vorbis, PCM/WAVE.

trans-unit.source: **Video:** H.263, H.264 AVC, MPEG-4 SP, VP8.
trans-unit.target: **Video:** H.263, H.264 AVC, MPEG-4 SP, VP8.

trans-unit.source: **Image:** jpg, pjpg, png, ppng, bmp, pbmp, gif, pgif, jpeg, pjpeg.
trans-unit.target: **Image:** jpg, pjpg, png, ppng, bmp, pbmp, gif, pgif, jpeg, pjpeg.

trans-unit.source: PDF, PPDF
trans-unit.target: PDF, PPDF

trans-unit.source: **pfile**
trans-unit.target: **pfile**

trans-unit.source: **text**
trans-unit.target: **text**

trans-unit.source: Pfile is a generic “wrapper” format for protected files that encapsulates the encrypted content and the RMS licenses and can be used to protect any file type.
trans-unit.target: Pfile is a generic “wrapper” format for protected files that encapsulates the encrypted content and the RMS licenses and can be used to protect any file type.

trans-unit.source: Text files, including XML, CSV, etc. can be opened for viewing in the app even when they are protected.
trans-unit.target: Text files, including XML, CSV, etc. can be opened for viewing in the app even when they are protected.

trans-unit.source: File types: txt, ptxt, csv, pcsv, log, plog, xml, pxml.
trans-unit.target: File types: txt, ptxt, csv, pcsv, log, plog, xml, pxml.

trans-unit.source: **Android devices that are not enrolled in Intune**
trans-unit.target: **Android devices that are not enrolled in Intune**

trans-unit.source: Before you can use the RMS sharing app to view files from other apps managed by Intune, launch the RMS app and authenticate with your work account.
trans-unit.target: Before you can use the RMS sharing app to view files from other apps managed by Intune, launch the RMS app and authenticate with your work account.

trans-unit.source: When you log in, you will see the following message **only if you don’t have an RMS license**:
trans-unit.target: When you log in, you will see the following message **only if you don’t have an RMS license**:

trans-unit.source: **Authentication Successful – You can now view corporate files, but your organization isn’t set up to let you protect files. Contact your IT admin for more details.**
trans-unit.target: **Authentication Successful – You can now view corporate files, but your organization isn’t set up to let you protect files. Contact your IT admin for more details.**

trans-unit.source: This does not prevent you from using the RMS sharing app to view company files.
trans-unit.target: This does not prevent you from using the RMS sharing app to view company files.

trans-unit.source: You can still open and view company files from other apps managed by Intune, and the MAM policies will still apply.
trans-unit.target: You can still open and view company files from other apps managed by Intune, and the MAM policies will still apply.

trans-unit.source: What this message is saying is that you will not be able to add the additional protection capabilities that the RMS sharing app provides.
trans-unit.target: What this message is saying is that you will not be able to add the additional protection capabilities that the RMS sharing app provides.

trans-unit.source: You must have an RMS license to add protection to your files.
trans-unit.target: You must have an RMS license to add protection to your files.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about RMS file protection capabilities, see [Protect a file on a device](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rights-management/rms-client/sharing-app-protect-in-place) and [Protect a file that you share by email](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rights-management/rms-client/sharing-app-protect-by-email).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about RMS file protection capabilities, see [Protect a file on a device](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rights-management/rms-client/sharing-app-protect-in-place) and [Protect a file that you share by email](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rights-management/rms-client/sharing-app-protect-by-email).

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: [Create and deploy mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune](create-and-deploy-mobile-app-management-policies-with-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Create and deploy mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune](create-and-deploy-mobile-app-management-policies-with-microsoft-intune.md)
